ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: (no one is safe from the punishment of his Lord);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely no one can be secure from the punishment of his Lord, --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the punishment of their Lord is not something for them to feel secure of,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the punishment of their Lord is not a thing to be unafraid of!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, the torment of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely the chastisement of their Lord is (a thing) not to be felt secure of--
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: (from their Lord's chastisement none feels secure)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! the doom of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: for none may ever feel secure from the punishment of their Lord;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the torment of their Lord is not a thing to feel secure from.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: (there is indeed no security from the punishment of their Lord)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For their Lord's displeasure is the opposite of Peace and Tranquillity;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! The torment of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: for none is secure from the punishment of their Lord,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Their Lord’s punishment is not to be taken for granted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:28] lo! there is no security from the chastisement of their Lord, [from] its being sent down —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Lo! the doom of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure) no guarantee of security has come to them from their Lord. 694
